Key Match Events: Lonzo Ball almost lazily brought the ball to the Bulls' end of the court before suddenly whipping a pass to Zach LaVine, allowing LaVine to score an easy layup
Post-Match Reflections: Chicago Bulls coach Billy Donovan kept him sidelined in the fourth quarter and overtime in Chicago's 139-137 victory against the Cleveland Cavaliers
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lonzo Ball was greeted with a standing ovation on Wednesday when he played for the Chicago Bulls for the first time since January 2022
Others: Lonzo Ball's two-way impact was impressive, showing flashes of his two-way impact against the Minnesota Timberwolves on Wednesday
